vi. 勘探；勘察

trans: n. 采用精神治疗法的医生

sentences.english: “People ask me what it's like to see his face on TV,” Ms. Weston, a retired psychotherapist, said on Thursday in her Upper East Side apartment. “It's always a bit of a shock when you first see him.

sentences.english: He found a psychotherapist near him to supervise his work with a surrogate, and flew the surrogate out from Los Angeles.
sentences.chinese: 他发现一名心理治疗师在旁边监督他与代理的工作，并让代理从洛杉矶飞往他那里。

detailed_translations.english: A psychotherapist is a person who treats people who are mentally ill using psychotherapy

sentences.chinese: 发生了这些事后，她对自己是否还受欢迎没把握。

副 词:perceptibly

sentences.chinese: 微小但可以察觉的变化

sentences.chinese: 我们把研究限定在十个案例以内。

sentences.chinese: 任何擅离职守的士兵都要受到在营房里关禁闭的处罚。

limits or borders

Delphic

sentences.chinese: 对于如果网站对内容不收费这些内容的质量是否会变差的调查有矛盾：34%的人认为会变差，同时30%的认为不会，而36%的人没有固定的意见。

sentences.chinese: 现在回头想想，我能够看出，在这个声明中，我所流露出的矛盾心理和些许的傲慢，但它确实是我内心感受的真实表达，因为这是自1982年以来，我第一次开始进行可能会失利的竞选活动。

sentences.chinese: 希安： 没错，这个词是与电脑有关的“网络”和“疑病症患者”这两个词的结合。 我们来听几个例句。

a rising current of warm air used by birds

name: visionary
trans: adj. 有眼光的，有远见的空想的，幻想的，不切实际的
n. 有幻觉的人好幻想的人；空想家有远见卓识者

sentences.english: Under his visionary leadership, the city prospered.
sentences.chinese: 在他富有远见的领导下，这座城市蓬勃发展。

detailed_translations.english: existing only in someone’s mind and unlikely to ever exist in the real world

detailed_translations.chinese: 空想家；梦想者；有眼力的人
detailed_translations.english: someone who has clear ideas and strong feelings about the way something should be in the future

name: envisage
trans: vt. 正视，面对；想像
时态:envisaged, envisaging, envisages

sentences.english: The scheme cost a lot more than we had originally envisaged.
sentences.chinese: 该计划的花费大大超出了我们最初所预想的数额。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is likely to happen in the future

name: perspective
trans: n. 远景，景前途；希望透视透视图观点，想法副 词:perspectively

sentences.english: the artist’s use of perspective
sentences.chinese: 那位画家对透视法的运用

sentences.english: a perspective of the whole valley
sentences.chinese: 山谷全景

sentences.english: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture

name: equivocate
trans: vi. 使用模棱两可的话隐瞒真相
时态:equivocated, equivocating, equivocates名 词:equivocator

sentences.english: He is equivocating a lot about what is going to happen if and when there are elections.
sentences.chinese: 他含含糊糊地说着很多如果进行选举会发生的状况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说模棱两可的话；支吾， 躲闪；推诿；含糊其词
detailed_translations.english: to avoid giving a clear or direct answer to a question

name: irrevocable
trans: adj. 不可改变的, 不可反转的副 词:irrevocably

sentences.english: Think about the situation carefully before you take an irrevocable step.
sentences.chinese: 在你踏出不能回头的一步之前要三思。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可改变的；不能取消的；不能挽回的
detailed_translations.english: an irrevocable decision, action etc cannot be changed or stopped

name: advocate
trans: vt. 提倡，主张，拥护
n. 提倡者；支持者；律师
时态:advocated, advocating, advocates名 词:advocator
形容词:advocatory

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。

detailed_translations.english: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly
someone who publicly supports someone or something

name: vociferous
trans: adj. 吵吵嚷嚷的大声叫喊的副 词:vociferously

sentences.english: They became more vociferous, and some of them began calling out what they thought of Hanna.
sentences.chinese: 他们变得更加吵闹了，一些人开始叫嚷着对汉娜的看法。

sentences.english: And one by one, encouraged by vociferous applause, speaking with fire and enthusiasm and excited gestures, they replied to the attack.
sentences.chinese: 他们一个个受到喧闹的欢呼鼓掌的鼓励，怀着火焰和激情，打着激动的手势，回答了对他们的攻击。

name: phonics
trans: n. 声学；声音基础教学法

name: phonetic
trans: adj. 语音的，语音学的；音形一致的；发音有细微区别的副 词:phonetically

sentences.english: a phonetic alphabet
sentences.chinese: 音标

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sounds of human speech

name: polyphonic
trans: adj. 有许多声音的,对位法的,复调的

name: cacophony
trans: n. 刺耳的声音,不和谐的声音

sentences.english: All around was a cacophony of voices.
sentences.chinese: 刺耳声响遍四周。

detailed_translations.english: a loud unpleasant mixture of sounds

name: curative
trans: adj. 医疗的
n. 药品

sentences.english: the spring’s alleged curative properties
sentences.chinese: 这处泉水号称能治病的功效

detailed_translations.chinese: 有助于治疗的，有疗效的
detailed_translations.english: able to or intended to cure illness

name: curator
trans: n. 馆长；监护人；管理者形容词:curatorial
名 词:curatorship

sentences.english: He’s Curator of Prints at the Metropolitan.
sentences.chinese: 他是大都会艺术博物馆印刷品馆部的主管。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of a  museum  or zoo

name: procure
trans: vt. 获得，取得；导致
vi. 取得
时态:procured, procuring, procures形容词:procurable

sentences.english: It remained very difficult to procure food, fuel, and other daily necessities.
sentences.chinese: 当时仍然很难获得食品、燃料和其他日用必需品。

detailed_translations.english: to obtain something, especially something that is difficult to get

name: sinecure
trans: n. 闲职；挂名职务名 词:sinecurist

sentences.english: She found him an exalted sinecure as a Fellow of the Library of Congress.
sentences.chinese: 她给他找了一个级别很高的闲职：国会图书馆研究员。

detailed_translations.english: a job which you get paid for even though you do not have to do very much work

name: perimeter
trans: n. 周边;周围;边缘形容词:perimetric

sentences.english: ...the perimeter of the airport.
sentences.chinese: …机场周边。

detailed_translations.chinese: 周长；周界；[眼科] 视野计
detailed_translations.english: the whole length of the border around an area or shape

name: periodontal
trans: adj. 牙齿周围的,齿根膜的

name: peripatetic
trans: adj.(教师)在多所学校兼课的徒步游历的,漫游的巡回的,巡游的

sentences.english: a peripatetic music teacher
sentences.chinese: 在多所学校任教的音乐教师

detailed_translations.english: travelling from place to place, especially in order to do your job

name: peripheral
trans: adj. 非本质的；非主要的，次要的，外围的周围的，边缘的
n. (计算机的)外围设备，周边设备副 词:peripherally

sentences.english: a diplomat who had a peripheral role in the negotiations
sentences.chinese: 在谈判中发挥辅助作用的外交官

sentences.english: Her involvement in the case was peripheral.
sentences.chinese: 她在这宗案件中是从犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 外围的；次要的；（神经）末梢区域的
detailed_translations.english: not as important as other things or people in a particular activity, idea, or situation
a piece of equipment that is connected to a computer and used with it, for example a  printer

name: sensor
trans: n. 传感器

sentences.english: The latest Japanese vacuum cleaners contain sensors that detect the amount of dust and type of floor.
sentences.chinese: 日本最新款吸尘器装有传感器，能测出灰尘量和地板类型。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used for discovering the presence of light, heat, movement etc

name: desensitize
trans: vt. 减少感光性,使不敏感
时态:desensitized, desensitizing, desensitizes名 词:desensitization
名 词:desensitizer

name: extrasensory
trans: adj. 超感官的, 超感觉的

name: sensuous
trans: adj. 感觉上的，依感观的；诉诸美感的副 词:sensuously

sentences.english: full sensuous lips
sentences.chinese: 饱满性感的嘴唇

sentences.english: a beautiful and sensuous young woman
sentences.chinese: 一个漂亮又性感的年轻女人

detailed_translations.chinese: 感觉上的，依感观的；诉诸美感的
detailed_translations.english: attractive in a sexual way

name: sophistry
trans: n. 诡辩术 (一次)诡辩

name: sophisticated
trans: adj. 老练的；老于世故的精密的，尖端的高雅的，有教养的

sentences.english: sophisticated software
sentences.chinese: 很先进的软件

sentences.english: a highly sophisticated weapons system
sentences.chinese: 非常精密的武器系统

detailed_translations.english: a sophisticated machine, system, method etc is very well designed and very advanced, and often works in a complicated way

name: sophomoric
trans: adj. 大学或四年制中学的二年级的,一知半解的

sentences.english: This was an uninformed article and sophomoric in its treatment of the specific technologies.
sentences.chinese: 这是一篇无知的文章，在某些技术问题上一知半解。

name: theosophy
trans: n. 见神论,接神论,接神学形容词:theosophic
名 词:theosophist

name: Achilles heel
trans: 致命弱点：指一个人或物品最薄弱的部分，容易被攻击或摧毁。

name: Arcadia
trans: n. 世外桃源；阿卡狄亚（古希腊一山区，人情淳朴，生活愉快）Arcadia
n. 阿卡狄亚，世外桃源

name: Cassandra
trans: n. 〈希神〉卡珊德拉,凶事预言家,不为人所信的预言家

name: cyclopean
trans: 蛮石Cyclopean
adj. 巨大的，庞大的

name: draconian
trans: adj. 非常严厉的;非常严酷的

sentences.english: ...indications that there would be no draconian measures to lower U.S. health care costs.
sentences.chinese: …迹象表明将不会有严厉的措施来降低美国的医疗成本。

detailed_translations.english: very strict and cruel

name: myrmidon
trans: n. 家仆；部下；忠实的追随者

name: nemesis
trans: n. 报应；给与惩罚的人；天罚Nemesis
n. 报应,复仇女神

sentences.english: Let not nemesis catch me by the swift ships.
sentences.chinese: 不要让报应女神娜美西斯用快捷的船舰捉拿我。

sentences.english: We worry that if the companion is not found, this paper will be our nemesis.
sentences.chinese: 我们担心，如果没有找到伴星，这篇论文就会成为我们的报应。

sentences.english: We considered startlingly that all the things before our eyes were out of nemesis , which were merely man's life .
sentences.chinese: 我们吃惊地以为眼前一切是报应，这只不过是人生。

detailed_translations.english: an opponent or enemy that is likely to be impossible for you to defeat, or a situation that is likely to be impossible for you to deal with

name: trojan horse
trans: [希神]特洛伊木马；特洛伊木马（一种计算机病毒）Trojan horse
n. 〈希神〉特洛伊木马,木马计,内部颠覆者

name: portage
trans: n. 搬运；运输
vi. 转到陆上运输
vt. 转到陆上运输；经陆上运输绕过
时态:portaged, portaging, portages

name: comport
trans: vt. 行为；举动
vi. 相称；适合；一致
时态:comported, comporting, comports

sentences.english: He comported himself in a way that won him respect.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为为自己赢得了尊重。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a particular way

name: deportment
trans: n. 举止;风度;仪态

sentences.english: His deportment is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 他的举止很有风度。

sentences.english: The Li code embraced beliefs, ethics, manners, deportment, social behaviour, ceremony and statecraft.
sentences.chinese: 这个礼仪规范包括信念、伦理、礼貌、举止、社会行为、礼仪和治国之道。

detailed_translations.english: the way that someone behaves in public

name: pendant
trans: n. 下垂物，垂饰

sentences.english: a ruby pendant
sentences.chinese: 红宝石吊坠

detailed_translations.english: a jewel, stone etc that hangs from a thin chain that you wear around your neck

name: append
trans: vt. 附加；贴上；盖章
n. [计]设置数据文件的搜索路径
时态:appended, appending, appends

sentences.english: She appended a note at the end of the letter.
sentences.chinese: 她在信件尾部附加了一个说明。

detailed_translations.english: to add something to a piece of writing

detailed_translations.chinese: 设置数据文件的搜索路径

name: appendage
trans: n. 附属物依附的人附属器官,附属肢体(如臂、腿、尾等)

sentences.english: Upon marriage, a woman automatically lost most of her legal rights and became an appendage of her husband.
sentences.chinese: 结婚后，妇女自动失去自己大部分的法律权利，成为丈夫的附属品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 附加物；下属；[动][解剖] 附器（如植物的枝叶和动物的腿尾）
detailed_translations.english: something that is connected to a larger or more important thing

name: suspend
trans: vt. 延缓，推迟；使暂停；使悬浮
vi. 悬浮；[体]禁赛
时态:suspended, suspending, suspends

sentences.english: Sales of the drug will be suspended until more tests are completed.
sentences.chinese: 这种药品在完成进一步检验之前将暂停销售。

sentences.english: Talks between the two countries have now been suspended.
sentences.chinese: 两国间的对话现已中止。

detailed_translations.english: to officially stop something from continuing, especially for a short time

name: panacea
trans: n. 治百病的药,万灵药

sentences.english: Trade is not a panacea for the world's economic or social ills.
sentences.chinese: 贸易不是世界经济或社会弊端的万灵丹。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that something is a panacea for a set of problems, you mean that it will solve all those problems

name: pandemonium
trans: n. 喧嚣, 嘈杂大混乱大混乱的场面, 嘈杂, 无序的地方Pandemonium
n. 混战场,喧哗吵闹形容词:pandemoniac

sentences.english: There was complete pandemonium in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 厨房里乱哄哄的。

sentences.english: When the verdict was read pandemonium broke out in the courtroom.
sentences.chinese: 宣判的时候法庭上乱成一团。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is a lot of noise because people are angry, confused or frightened

name: pantheism
trans: n. 泛神论名 词:pantheist

name: panoply
trans: n. 华丽服饰；全套甲胄，全副盔甲

name: extradite
trans: vt. 引渡
时态:extradited, extraditing, extradites

sentences.english: A judge agreed to extradite him to Texas.
sentences.chinese: 一位法官同意将他引渡到德克萨斯州。

detailed_translations.english: to use a legal process to send someone who may be guilty of a crime back to the country where the crime happened in order to judge them in a court of law

name: extrapolate
trans: vt. (由已知资料对未知事实或价值)推算,推断
时态:extrapolated, extrapolating, extrapolates名 词:extrapolation

sentences.english: Extrapolating from his latest findings, he reckons about 80% of these deaths might be attributed to smoking.
sentences.chinese: 从他最近的发现推断，他估计大约80%的这类死亡可能归因于吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to use facts about the present or about one thing or group to make a guess about the future or about other things or groups

name: extrovert
trans: n. 性格外向的人活跃、愉快、爱交际的人

sentences.english: Her sister was always more of an extrovert.
sentences.chinese: 她妹妹总是更外向些。

detailed_translations.chinese: 外向；外倾者；性格外向者（等于extravert）
detailed_translations.english: someone who is active and confident, and who enjoys spending time with other people

name: extraneous
trans: adj. 外部的,外来的无关的,不相干的,无联系的

sentences.english: extraneous noises
sentences.chinese: 外面传来的噪声

detailed_translations.chinese: 外来的；没有关联的；来自体外的
detailed_translations.english: coming from outside

name: photoelectric
trans: adj. 光电的

sentences.english: Advanced imported photoelectric supervision system is used.
sentences.chinese: 采用先进的进口光电眼监控系统。

detailed_translations.english: using an electrical current that is controlled by light

name: photovoltaic
trans: n. 光电的名 词:photovoltaic

name: photon
trans: n. [物]光子；辐射量子；[医]见光度（等于light quantum）形容词:photonic

sentences.english: This is the energy of an ultraviolet photon, a "large" energy on the atomic scale .
sentences.chinese: 这是一个紫外光子的能量，在原子尺度上，它是一个“大”能量。

sentences.english: This in turn left its mark on the polarization of the next photon, so amplifying the signal.
sentences.chinese: 光子就这样轮流地将它的偏振标记留给下一个光子，因而增强了信号。

sentences.english: The light from these dim objects arrives at a trickle of only one photon per minute in each square centimeter.
sentences.chinese: 当这些昏暗物体发出的光抵达地球，在每平方公分内每分钟只有一个光子。

detailed_translations.english: a unit of  energy  that carries light and has  zero mass

name: photosynthesis
trans: n. 光合作用; 光能合成形容词:photosynthetic

sentences.english: It has at least one gene necessary for photosynthesis—so far it’s the only animal known with this ability.
sentences.chinese: 它有至少一个基因是光合作用所必需的——到目前为止这是唯一被发现具有此项能力的动物。

sentences.english: The belt of vegetation that crosses Africa below the Sahara is very dark because most of the sunlight is absorbed by plants for photosynthesis.
sentences.chinese: 在撒哈拉沙漠下方，横贯非洲中部的植被带颜色非常深，因为植物由于光合作用吸收了大多数太阳光。

sentences.english: As the ocean warms, it becomes more stratified, with the warmer water remaining at the top where the organisms need to be in order to do photosynthesis.
sentences.chinese: 但是随着海水变暖，它的层次会更加分明，温度更高的海水会停留在表面，而这里正是生物体进行光合作用必需的地方。

detailed_translations.english: the production by a green plant of special substances like sugar that it uses as food, caused by the action of sunlight on  chlorophyll (= the green substance in leaves )

name: lucid
trans: adj. 表达清楚的, 明白易懂的神志还清醒的副 词:lucidly

sentences.english: You must write in a clear and lucid style.
sentences.chinese: 你的写作风格一定要清楚易懂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 明晰的；透明的；易懂的；头脑清楚的
detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is clear and easy to understand

name: elucidate
trans: vt. 阐明,解释
时态:elucidated, elucidating, elucidates名 词:elucidation
形容词:elucidative
名 词:elucidator

sentences.english: The full picture has not yet been elucidated.
sentences.chinese: 详细情况还没有解释清楚。

detailed_translations.english: to explain something that is difficult to understand by providing more information

name: lucubration
trans: n. ①挑灯攻读;钻研文学作品

detailed_translations.chinese: 刻苦钻研；苦心而成的著作

name: translucent
trans: adj. 半透明的透亮的;清澈的清楚易懂的

sentences.english: Blue veins showed through her translucent skin.
sentences.chinese: 她半透明的皮肤下青筋显现。

detailed_translations.english: not trans-parent, but clear enough to allow light to pass through

name: mortality
trans: n. 必死性大量死亡死亡率

sentences.english: Mortality from heart disease varies widely across the world.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病死亡率世界各地差异很大。

detailed_translations.english: the number of deaths during a particular period of time among a particular type or group of people

name: moribund
trans: adj. 垂死的；停滞不前的
n. 垂死的人

sentences.english: The patient was moribund by the time the doctor arrived.
sentences.chinese: 医生赶到的时候病人已经奄奄一息。

detailed_translations.english: slowly dying

name: amortize
trans: vt. 分期偿还(债务)
时态:amortized, amortizing, amortizes形容词:amortizable

sentences.english: There's little advantage to amortizing the loan, especially on a 30 or 40-year basis.
sentences.chinese: 分期偿还这项贷款没有什么好处，尤其是按30或40年偿还。

detailed_translations.english: to pay a debt by making regular payments

name: mortify
trans: vt. 使受辱,伤害(人的感情)克制,抑制(肉体、情感等)
vi. (指肌肤)变成坏疽
时态:mortified, mortifying, mortifies

sentences.english: Jane mortified her family by leaving her husband.
sentences.chinese: 简的家人为简离开丈夫感到奇耻大辱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使蒙受屈辱， 使难堪
detailed_translations.english: If you say that something mortifies you, you mean that it offends or embarrasses you a great deal

name: atrophy
trans: n. 萎缩，萎缩症；发育停止
vi. 萎缩；虚脱形容词:atrophic

sentences.english: If you don't exercise your muscles, they weaken and atrophy.
sentences.chinese: 如果不锻炼你的肌肉，肌力就削弱和萎缩了。

sentences.english: If compassion can only be activated by sustained attention, which is prevented by fast-cut editing, then the ability to be genuinely moved by another’s story could atrophy.
sentences.chinese: 如果只能通过持续的关注激活同情心，而这种关注又受到快速切断编辑的阻碍，那么，被他人的故事真正打动的能力就会萎缩。

sentences.english: The compounds "likely have an effecton motor neurons"—responsible for controlling movements—"but that isa hunch at present, based on the type of atrophy we saw, " Hughes said inan email.

sentences.english: A second type of thermal escape is far more dramatic. This form of thermal escape is called hydrodynamic escape or, more evocatively, the planetary wind.

sentences.english: It was theorized with a high degree of probability that the change in period was due to the nonlinearity of the hydrodynamic pressure acting on the upstream face of the dam.
sentences.chinese: 据推论最大可能性是在那一时间段非线性水压作用于坝体上游面所造成的差别。

Centigrade is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °C.

名 词:temperer

a substance used to make you empty your  bowel s

trans: n. 毫秒

sentences.chinese: 所有案例的每一项法律意见的每一草稿在公布前都要经我们办公室的一位律师和一位法律助理审读。

name: metaphysics

name: metonymy

name: percolate

vt. (用渗滤壶)煮(咖啡)渗滤
时态:percolated, percolating, percolates名 词:percolation

sentences.chinese: 雨水只会慢慢地渗进来。

detailed_translations.english: if liquid, light, or air percolates somewhere, it passes slowly through a material that has very small holes in it

sentences.chinese: 一种无望的情绪笼罩着该国。

detailed_translations.english: if a feeling, idea, or smell pervades a place, it is present in every part of it

名 词:permeation

detailed_translations.english: when people vote in order to make a decision about a particular subject, rather than voting for a person

name: ultimatum
trans: n. 最后通牒；最后结论；基本原理

sentences.english: The club gave him an ultimatum – either he apologized, or he would be expelled from the team.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部给他下了最后通牒——要么道歉，要么等着被开除出队。

sentences.english: The army issued an ultimatum for all weapons in the city to be surrendered on October 26th.
sentences.chinese: 军队发出最后通牒，必须于 10 月 26 日交出该市的全部武器。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最后通牒；最后结论；基本原理
detailed_translations.english: a threat saying that if someone does not do what you want by a particular time, you will do something to punish them

name: verbose
trans: adj. 冗长的；啰嗦的副 词:verbosely

sentences.english: For once, his usually verbose wife was content to listen.
sentences.chinese: 他那个一贯唠叨的老婆难得一次愿意倾听。

sentences.english: Legal writing is often unclear and verbose.
sentences.chinese: 法律文书往往措辞含糊，行文冗长。

detailed_translations.english: using or containing too many words

name: proverb
trans: n. 谚语，格言；众所周知的人或事

sentences.english: An old Arab proverb says, "The enemy of my enemy is my friend."
sentences.chinese: 有一句古老的阿拉伯谚语说：“我敌人的敌人是我的朋友。”

detailed_translations.english: a short well-known statement that gives advice or expresses something that is generally true. ‘A penny saved is a penny earned’ is an example of a proverb.

name: verbatim
trans: adj. & ad
v. (完全)照字面的(地),逐字的(地)
n. 逐字翻译

sentences.english: The president's speeches are regularly reproduced verbatim in the state-run newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 这位总统的演讲经常会一字不差地被刊登在那些国有报纸上。

detailed_translations.english: If you repeat something verbatim, you use exactly the same words as were used originally
repeating the actual words that were spoken or written

name: verbiage
trans: n. 冗词；废话；措辞方式

sentences.english: meaningless verbiage
sentences.chinese: 不知所云的冗词

detailed_translations.english: speech or writing that has many unnecessary words in it

name: simile
trans: n. (使用like或as等词语的)明喻

sentences.english: In Book One alone there are four primary instances of what we can think of as this primary simile dynamic.
sentences.chinese: 仅第一本里就有四个主要的例证,我们可以看作最初的明喻来源的动力。

sentences.english: Lister said people should follow the 1946 advice of writer George Orwell: "Never use a metaphor, simile, or other figure of speech which you are used to seeing in print.
sentences.chinese: 李斯特说人们最好遵循作家乔治·奥威尔1946年提出的建议：“不要使用那些在各种出版物上频繁出现的暗喻、明喻或其他修辞格。”

sentences.english: The simile is a common device and a useful one, but similes coming in rapid fire, one right on top of another, are more distracting than illuminating.
sentences.chinese: 明喻是常用的修辞术，也很好用，但是像连珠炮式的比喻与其说是富有启发性，不如说是在转移注意力。

detailed_translations.english: an expression that describes something by comparing it with something else, using the words ‘as’ or ‘like’, for example ‘as white as snow’

name: assimilate
trans: vt. & vi. 吸收, 消化同化
时态:assimilated, assimilating, assimilates名 词:assimilator

sentences.english: It will take time to assimilate all these facts.
sentences.chinese: 充分掌握所有这些情况需要时间。

detailed_translations.english: to completely understand and begin to use new ideas, information etc
if people assimilate, or are assimilated into a country or group, they become part of that group and are accepted by the people in that group

name: simulacrum
trans: n. 像,影,幻影,模拟物,假的东西

name: simulate
trans: vt. 模仿；假装；冒充
adj. 模仿的；假装的
时态:simulated, simulating, simulates形容词:simulative

sentences.english: a machine that simulates conditions in space
sentences.chinese: 一台模拟太空环境的机器

sentences.english: Interviews can be simulated in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 可以在教室里模拟面试。

detailed_translations.english: to make or produce something that is not real but has the appearance or feeling of being real

name: transcend
trans: vt. 超出或超越(经验、信念、描写能力等)的范围优于或胜过…
时态:transcended, transcending, transcends

sentences.english: The desire for peace transcended political differences.
sentences.chinese: 对和平的渴望超越了政治分歧。

detailed_translations.english: to go beyond the usual limits of something

name: condescend
trans: vi. 屈尊, 俯就故意表示和蔼可亲
时态:condescended, condescending, condescends

sentences.english: When he condescended to speak, he contradicted himself three or four times in the space of half an hour.
sentences.chinese: 当他屈尊讲话时，半小时内有三四次前后矛盾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈尊；俯就；（对某人）表现出优越感
detailed_translations.english: to behave as if you think you are better, more intelligent, or more important than other people – used to show disapproval

name: descendant
trans: n. 后代, 后裔

sentences.english: If you must use descendant selectors, prefer child selectors, which at least only require evaluation of one additional node, not all the intermediate nodes up to an ancestor.
sentences.chinese: 如果您必须使用后代选择器，尽量使用子代选择器，这最少只需评估一个额外的节点，而非中间直至祖先的所有节点。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is related to a person who lived a long time ago, or to a family, group of people etc that existed in the past

name: ascendancy
trans: n. 优势；支配地位

name: antonym
trans: n. [语]反义词形容词:antonymous
名 词:antonymy

sentences.english: a dictionary of synonyms and antonyms
sentences.chinese: 同义词和反义词词典

detailed_translations.english: a word that means the opposite of another word

name: eponymous
trans: adj. 齐名的

name: patronymic
trans: adj. 取自教父名的
n. 源于父名的姓或名字

name: pseudonym
trans: n. 假名；笔名形容词:pseudonymous

sentences.english: Both plays were published under the pseudonym of Philip Dayre.
sentences.chinese: 两个剧本都是以菲利普·戴尔的笔名发表的。

detailed_translations.english: an invented name that a writer, artist etc uses instead of their real name

name: conscription
trans: n. 征兵

sentences.english: Your body full compliance with the requirements of conscription.
sentences.chinese: 你的身体完全符合征兵要求。

sentences.english: They were rather earnest about the Tommies, and the threat of conscription, and the shortage of sugar and toffee for the children.
sentences.chinese: 他们对于军队，对于征兵的恐吓，对于儿童们的糖与糖果的缺乏，是颇郑重其事的。

sentences.english: Other sources of extra-budgetary income include funds from the central government and local governments for defense mobilization preparations, conscription, and demobilization.
sentences.chinese: 其他预算外进项来源包括来自中央和地方用于防卫动员的准备工作、征兵以及复员安排的资金。

detailed_translations.english: when people are made to join the army, navy etc

name: circumscribe
trans: vt. 在…周围划线划定…范围；限制，限定
时态:circumscribed，circumscribing，circumscribes

sentences.english: The President’s power is circumscribed by Congress and the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 总统的权力受到国会和最高法院的制约。

detailed_translations.chinese: 外切，外接；限制；在…周围画线
detailed_translations.english: to limit power, rights, or abilities

name: inscription
trans: n. (作者)题词, 献词

sentences.english: a Latin inscription on the memorial stone
sentences.chinese: 纪念碑上的拉丁语碑文

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing inscribed on a stone, in the front of a book etc

name: proscribe
trans: vt. 正式宣布(某事物)有危险或被禁止
时态:proscribed, proscribing, proscribes

sentences.english: The Act proscribes discrimination on the grounds of race.
sentences.chinese: 这项法令禁止种族歧视。

detailed_translations.english: to officially say that something is not allowed to exist or be done

name: fallacy
trans: n. 谬论，谬误

sentences.english: It’s a common fallacy that a neutered dog will become fat and lazy.
sentences.chinese: 说阉割过的狗会变得又胖又懒，这是普遍的谬见。

detailed_translations.english: a false idea or belief, especially one that a lot of people believe is true

name: fallacious
trans: adj. 谬误的;虚妄的;欺骗的;靠不住的; 不合逻辑的;令人失望的副 词:fallaciously

sentences.english: Such an argument is misleading, if not wholly fallacious.
sentences.chinese: 这种论点即使不完全是谬误，也是误导人的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谬误的；骗人的；靠不住的；不合理的
detailed_translations.english: containing or based on false ideas

name: fallibility
trans: n. 易错,不可靠,易误

sentences.english: "Trump has exposed the inadequacy and fallibility of decades-old domestic political strategy of governing by polls and contrived expectations, " she said.
sentences.chinese: “几十年来，美国用民调和设想中的期望来治国，特朗普已经暴露了这种政治策略的不足和不可靠之处，”她说。

name: infallible
trans: adj. 不会犯错误的，无过失的极准确的，极精确的绝对可靠的；万无一失的；永远有效的副 词:infallibly

sentences.english: He had an infallible cure for a hangover.
sentences.chinese: 他有对付宿醉绝对灵验的良方。

detailed_translations.chinese: 绝对可靠的；绝无错误的
detailed_translations.english: something that is infallible always works or has the intended effect

detailed_translations.chinese: 永远正确的人；绝无谬误的事物

name: soluble
trans: adj. 可溶的，可溶解的；可解决的名 词:solubleness

sentences.english: soluble aspirin
sentences.chinese: 可溶性阿司匹林

detailed_translations.english: a soluble substance can be  dissolved  in a liquid

name: absolution
trans: n. 宽恕；赦罪(誓言、诺言或责任的)免除，解除

sentences.english: Pope Leo gave him absolution.
sentences.chinese: 教皇列奥赦免了他的罪孽。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is formally forgiven by the Christian Church or a priest for the things they have done wrong

name: dissolution
trans: n. (社团等)解散；(婚约等的)解除分散；溶解衰败；死亡，消亡 离婚

sentences.english: the dissolution of the monasteries
sentences.chinese: 修道院的解散

detailed_translations.chinese: 分解，溶解；（议会等的）解散；（契约等的）解除；死亡
detailed_translations.english: the act of breaking up an organization, institution etc so that it no longer exists

name: resolute
trans: adj. 坚决的；果断的副 词:resolutely
名 词:resoluteness

sentences.english: resolute opposition
sentences.chinese: 坚决的反对

sentences.english: resolute leadership
sentences.chinese: 果断的领导

sentences.english: She remained resolute in her belief that the situation would improve.
sentences.chinese: 她依然坚信情况将会好转。

detailed_translations.english: doing something in a very determined way because you have very strong beliefs, aims etc

name: hydraulic
trans: adj. 液力的,液压的,水力学的

sentences.english: a hydraulic pump
sentences.chinese: 水压泵，液压泵

sentences.english: hydraulic brakes
sentences.chinese: 液压制动器

detailed_translations.chinese: 液压的；水力的；水力学的
detailed_translations.english: moved or operated by the pressure of water or other liquid

name: dehydrate
trans: vt. 使脱水, 使干燥
vi. (人体的)脱水, 失水
时态:dehydrated, dehydrating, dehydrates名 词:dehydrator

sentences.english: The substance is dehydrated and stored as powder.
sentences.chinese: 该物质经脱水处理后以粉末形式储存。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…脱水；使极其口渴；使丧失力量和兴趣等
detailed_translations.english: to remove the liquid from a substance such as food or a chemical

name: hydroelectric
trans: adj. 水力发电的名 词:hydroelectricity

sentences.english: a huge hydroelectric power station
sentences.chinese: 大型水力发电站

detailed_translations.chinese: 水力发电的；水电治疗的
detailed_translations.english: using water power to produce electricity

name: hydroponics
trans: n. 水耕法,水栽培形容词:hydroponic

name: aegis
trans: n. 保护；庇护支持，赞助；主办在…的支持下，在…的保护下由…主办，由…发起

name: charisma
trans: n. 神授的能力；非凡的领导力；魅力复 数: charismata

sentences.english: He lacks charisma.
sentences.chinese: 他缺乏个人魅力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 魅力；神授的能力；非凡的领导力
detailed_translations.english: a natural ability to attract and interest other people and make them admire you

name: ego
trans: n. 自我; 自尊; 自负

sentences.english: That promotion really boosted her ego (= made her feel better about herself ).
sentences.chinese: 那次晋升确实增强了她的自信心。

sentences.english: I need someone to massage my bruised ego (= when you feel less confident than before ).
sentences.chinese: 我需要有人来安抚我受挫的自信心。

sentences.english: a fragile ego
sentences.chinese: 脆弱的自尊心

detailed_translations.chinese: 自我，自己，个人思考和感觉能力
detailed_translations.english: the opinion that you have about yourself

name: ethos
trans: n. (个人或团体的)气质，精神特质；思潮

sentences.english: a community in which people lived according to an ethos of sharing and caring
sentences.chinese: 人们本着分享与关爱精神来生活的社区

detailed_translations.chinese: 民族精神；气质；社会思潮

name: hubris
trans: n. 骄傲自大,自恃

sentences.english: ...a tale of how an honourable man pursuing honourable goals was afflicted with hubris and led his nation toward catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: ...一个有关追求崇高目标的磊落君子如何因自高自大、而将自己的国家引向灾难的故事。

detailed_translations.english: too much pride

name: ID
trans: n. 遗传素质；本能冲动ID
n. 身份证明(文件)

name: libido
trans: n. 性欲；生命力形容词:libidinal

name: muralist
trans: n. 壁画家

name: intramural
trans: adj. 校内的,内部的

name: extramural
trans: adj. 市外的,单位以外的,校际比赛的

name: immure
trans: vt. 把…嵌在墙上；监禁，禁闭
时态:immured, immuring, immures名 词:immurement

detailed_translations.english: to shut someone in a place so that they cannot get out

name: politic
trans: adj. 精明的；有策略的；狡猾的；审慎的
vi. 拉选票

sentences.english: Many towns often found it politic to change their allegiance.
sentences.chinese: 许多城镇经常发现改变拥戴对象不失为明智之举。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精明的；有策略的；狡猾的；审慎的；政治的
detailed_translations.english: sensible and likely to gain you an advantage

name: politicize
trans: vt. 使政治化, 使具有政治性使对政治有兴趣
时态:politicized, politicizing, politicizes

name: acropolis
trans: n. 古希腊城市的卫城,雅典的卫城

name: megalopolis
trans: n. 巨大都市,人口稠密地带

sentences.english: ...the densely populated megalopolis that stretches down the East Coast from Boston to Washington.
sentences.chinese: ...沿着从波士顿到华盛顿的东海岸连绵不断、人口稠密的特大城市带。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨大都市, 人口稠密地带

name: numerology
trans: n. 数字命理学,数字占卦术

name: alphanumeric
trans: adj. 文字数字的,包括文字与数字的

name: enumerate
trans: vt. 列举，枚举；数
时态:enumerated，enumerating，enumerates名 词:enumeration
形容词:enumerative
名 词:enumerator

sentences.english: I enumerate the work that will have to be done.
sentences.chinese: 我将必须要做的工作一一列举出来。

detailed_translations.english: to name a list of things one by one

name: supernumerary
trans: n. 定额以外的人,临时雇工

name: kilobyte
trans: n. 千字节，1024字节

sentences.english: Ext2fs is designed for block devices like IDE devices, where the logical block size will be on the order of 512 bytes, 1 kilobyte, and so on.
sentences.chinese: Ext2fs 是为象 IDE 设备那样的块设备设计的，这些设备的逻辑块大小是 512 字节，1 K 字节等这样的倍数。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring computer information, equal to 1,024 bytes

name: kilometer
trans: n. 〈美〉千米, 公里形容词:kilometric

sentences.english: She had to battle snowstorms, landslides, snakes and loneliness on her 350 kilometer journey.
sentences.chinese: 在350公里的行程中，她要克服暴风雪、滑坡、蛇和孤独寂寞。

sentences.english: But it says food grown and harvested in the 30-kilometer exclusion zone after the emergency might be contaminated and should be avoided.
sentences.chinese: 但是，该组织说，事故发生后，在30公里禁区内种植和收获的食物可能受到污染，应该避免食用。

sentences.english: For example, the researchers last week said they had managed to gather enough energy from a TV station a half-kilometer away to power a small temperature sensor.
sentences.chinese: 例如，研究人员上周说，他们已经设法从半公里远的一座电视发射台收集了足够了能量给一个小型温度传感器供电。

detailed_translations.chinese: [计量] 公里；[计量] 千米（等于kilometre）

name: kilohertz
trans: n. 千赫

name: kilogram
trans: n. 公斤；千克

sentences.english: By comparison, one kilogram of tomatoes requires 160 litres of water.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，生产一公斤的番茄需要160升水。

sentences.english: For example, the kilogram scale allows you to assign a number to an object indicating its weight based upon standardized displacements of measuring instruments.
sentences.chinese: 例如，千克尺度允许您给一个物体分配数字，根据测量仪器的标准化的偏移量指示该物体的重量。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring weight, equal to 1,000 grams

name: microbe
trans: n. 细菌，微生物形容词:microbial

sentences.english: ...a type of bacteria that include the microbes responsible for tuberculosis and leprosy.
sentences.chinese: …包括引起结核病和麻风病的微生物在内的一类细菌。

detailed_translations.english: an extremely small living thing which you can only see if you use a  microscope  . Some microbes can cause diseases.

name: microbiologist
trans: 微生物学家

sentences.english: I remember when Jurassic Park came out, a microbiologist friend constantly told me how outlandish it was, but within a few years, he said it was interesting how far things have come.
sentences.chinese: 我记得当《侏罗纪公园》出现的时候，一个微生物学家朋友不断的告诉我这影片太奇异了，但是在几年之内，他说影片中的科技到底还有多久才能实现很令人感兴趣。

sentences.english: Scientists have been debating this issue since 1892, when Dmitry Ivanovsky, a Russian microbiologist, reported that an infection in tobacco plants spreads via something smaller than a bacterium.
sentences.chinese: 自1892年以来科学家一直在争论这个(病毒是死是活的）问题。 当时俄罗斯微生物学家德米特里｀伊凡诺夫斯基报告说烟草中的一种病通过比细菌还要小的东西传播。

name: microbrew
trans: n. 〈美〉(小厂酿制供自用的)小厂啤酒

name: microclimate
trans: n. 小气候(指森林、城市、洞穴等局部地区的气候)名 词:microclimatology

name: multicellular
trans: adj. 多细胞的

sentences.english: a multicellular organism
sentences.chinese: 多细胞有机体

detailed_translations.chinese: [生物] 多细胞的；多空隙的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many cells

name: multidisciplinary
trans: adj. 包括各种学科的,有关各种学问的

name: multifarious
trans: adj. 许多的,多方面的各式各样的

sentences.english: multifarious business activities
sentences.chinese: 各种各样的商业活动

detailed_translations.chinese: 多种的， 各式各样的
detailed_translations.english: of many different kinds

name: multilateral
trans: adj. 多方面的;多边的
n. 多边贸易ad
v. 多方面地;多边地

sentences.english: a multilateral arms treaty
sentences.chinese: 多边军火协定

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 多边的；多国的，多国参加的
detailed_translations.english: involving several different countries or groups

name: parity
trans: n. 同等,相等,对等奇偶校验

sentences.english: Women have yet to achieve wage or occupational parity in many fields.
sentences.chinese: 妇女们在许多领域尚有待获得薪酬或职业的平等。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平价；同等；相等；胎次；分娩
detailed_translations.english: the state of being equal, especially having equal pay, rights, or power

name: disparity
trans: n. 不同，不等；不一致；悬殊

detailed_translations.english: a difference between two or more things, especially an unfair one

name: nonpareil
trans: adj. 无比的,独特的
n. 无可匹敌的人或物,举世无双的人或物

sentences.english: Pop music was condemned as decadent and crude.
sentences.chinese: 流行音乐被指责为堕落而又粗俗。

detailed_translations.english: having low moral standards and being more concerned with pleasure than serious matters

name: cadence
trans: n. 节奏；韵律；抑扬顿挫形容词:cadenced

sentences.english: the cadence of my mother’s voice
sentences.chinese: 我母亲语调的抑扬顿挫

detailed_translations.english: the way someone’s voice rises and falls, especially when reading out loud

name: cadenza
trans: n. [音]装饰乐段

sentences.english: So here's Chuck Mangione with his saxophonist and a saxophone cadenza.
sentences.chinese: 这就是查克·曼卓林,和他的萨克斯手一起演出的一段华彩乐章

sentences.english: The violinist had the technical skill to execute the cadenza, with its double stops and harmonics, with brilliance .
sentences.chinese: 小提琴手有用双倍停顿及和弦来精彩地演奏华彩乐段的技能。

sentences.english: A cadenza should not break away from the style of the work, it should be like a summing up, an epilogue, but with a little touch of Whoops!
sentences.chinese: 一个华彩乐段应该保持在作品的风格范围内，它应该像一个总结、一个收场白，但是要有一个小小的闪现：喔唷！

detailed_translations.english: a difficult part of a long piece of music, which a performer plays alone in order to show his or her skill

name: tribute
trans: n. 贡物；颂词；礼物

sentences.english: The players wore black armbands as a tribute to their late teammate.
sentences.chinese: 球员们戴着黑纱悼念已故的队友。

sentences.english: I’d like to pay tribute to (= praise and admire publicly ) the party workers for all their hard work.
sentences.chinese: 我谨向党内工作人员致敬，感谢他们的辛苦努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼物；[税收] 贡物；颂词；（尤指对死者的）致敬，悼念，吊唁礼物
detailed_translations.english: something that you say, do, or give in order to express your respect or admiration for someone

name: tributary
trans: n. 支流进贡国,附庸国进贡者
adj. (需向…)进贡的,附庸的辅助的支流的

sentences.english: ...the Napo river, a tributary of the Amazon.
sentences.chinese: ...纳波河，亚马孙河的一条支流。

detailed_translations.english: a stream or river that flows into a larger river

name: attribute
trans: v. 把…归因于；认为…是由于认为（文章、艺术品或评论）出自…将（品质或特征）加于…;认为…为…所有
n. 特性；特质；属性
时态:attributed，attributing，attributes形容词:attributable
名词:attribution

sentences.english: Women tend to attribute their success to external causes such as luck.
sentences.chinese: 女性往往把她们的成功归因于外因，如运气。

detailed_translations.english: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation
a quality or feature, especially one that is considered to be good or useful

name: retribution
trans: n. (由于伤害等)应得的惩罚或赔偿

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["punishment by God"],"COLLOINEXA":["divine retribution"]}
sentences.chinese: 上帝的惩罚

detailed_translations.english: severe punishment for something very serious

name: halcyon
trans: adj. 平静的,太平的,幸福的

sentences.english: It was all a far cry from those halcyon days in 1990, when he won three tournaments on the European tour.
sentences.chinese: 这和1990年的那些美好时光迥然不同，当时他在欧洲巡回赛中赢了三场锦标赛。

detailed_translations.english: A halcyon time is a time in the past that was peaceful or happy

name: meander
trans: n. 漫步；曲流（常用复数）
vt. 漫步；蜿蜒缓慢流动
vi. 漫步；漫谈
时态:meandered, meandering, meanders形容词:meandrous

sentences.english: We took a gravel road that meandered through farmland.
sentences.chinese: 我们走上了一条蜿蜒穿越农田的石子路。

detailed_translations.english: to walk somewhere in a slow relaxed way rather than take the most direct way possible

name: Oedipal
trans: adj. 恋母情结的

name: ostracize
trans: vt. 放逐，流放摈弃；排斥
时态:ostracized，ostracizing，ostracizes

sentences.english: She was afraid that if she spoke up her colleagues would ostracize her.
sentences.chinese: 她担心，如果她说出来，同事们就会孤立她。

sentences.english: He was ostracized by the other students.
sentences.chinese: 他受到其他学生的排斥。

detailed_translations.chinese: 放逐；排斥；按贝壳流放法放逐
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people ostracize someone, they refuse to accept them as a member of the group

name: paean
trans: n. 赞美歌，欢乐歌

sentences.english: ...a paean to deep, passionate love.
sentences.chinese: ...一首对深切而富有激情的爱情的颂歌。

detailed_translations.english: a happy song of praise, thanks, or victory

name: philippic
trans: n. 猛烈的抨击,痛斥

name: satyr
trans: n. 好色之徒；萨梯（希腊神话中森林之神）；[昆]眼蝶科形容词:satyric

detailed_translations.chinese: 好色之徒；萨梯（希腊神话中森林之神）；眼蝶科

name: zealot
trans: n. 狂热者；犹太教狂热信徒

sentences.english: religious zealots
sentences.chinese: 宗教狂热分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 狂热者；犹太教狂热信徒
detailed_translations.english: someone who has extremely strong beliefs, especially religious or political beliefs, and is too eager to make other people share them
